predicate.note: Frames file for 'kick' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes carry-11.4-1 hit-18.1 split-23.2 throw-17.1; other framed members include: push; hit, strike; cut, draw, pull, push, roll, slip; fire, hit, pass. Comparison with 'hit' and 'begin'.

roleset.name: drive or impel with the foot

example.name: not a foot
example.text: But two big New York banks seem *trace* to have kicked those chances away, for the moment, with the embarrassing failure of Citicorp and Chase Manhattan Corp. to deliver $7.2 billion in bank financing for a leveraged buy-out of United Airlines parent UAL Corp.
example.arg: the embarrassing failure of Citicorp and Chase Manhattan Corp. to deliver $7.2 billion in bank financing for a leveraged buy-out of United Airlines parent UAL Corp

example.name: no instrument
example.text: John tried *trace* to kick the football, but Mary pulled it away at the last moment.

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: While program trades swiftly kicked in, a ``circuit breaker'' that halted trading in stock futures in Chicago made some program trading impossible.

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary gamely kicked in $5 to John's bail.

example.name: all args
example.text: The yearlong schedule of festivities will be kicked *trace* off officially with a combination live and animation half-time special at the Super Bowl in January.
example.arg: a combination live and animation half-time special
